data.title: Pope Alexander VI, horoscope for birth date 31 December 1430 Jul.Cal. (9 Jan 1431 greg.), born in Játiva, with Astrodatabank biography
data.meta_description: Horoscope and astrology data of Pope Alexander VI born on 31 December 1430 Jul.Cal. (9 Jan 1431 greg.) Játiva, Spain, with biography
data.text:
Name

Pope Alexander VI Gender: M

Birthname Borja, Rodrigo de born on 31 December 1430 Jul.Cal. (9 Jan 1431 greg.) at 07:24 (= 07:24 AM ) Place Játiva, Spain, 38n59, 0w31 Timezone LMT m0w31 (is local mean time) Data source

Conflicting/unverified

Rodden Rating DD Collector: Rodden

Astrology data 18°30' 05°11 Asc. 18°06'

Biography

Spanish-Italian ecclesiastic; elected Roman Catholic pope on 10 August 1492 OS. A member of the infamous Borgias, his corrupt, worldly and ambitious papacy contributed to the decline of the prestige of the church. Borgia was a lawyer and a church administrator. He fathered many children.

He died on 18 August 1502 OS, Rome, probably of poisoning.

Link to Wikipedia biography

Relationships

parent->child relationship with Borgia, Cesare (born 13 September 1475 Jul.Cal. (22 Sep 1475 greg.)). Notes: Borgia was an illegitimate son of the Pope

parent->child relationship with Borgia, Lucrezia (born 19 April 1479 Jul.Cal. (28 Apr 1479 greg.))

Events

Work : Gain social status 10 August 1492 (greg.) (Elected Pope Alexander VI)

chart Placidus Equal_H.

Death, Mysterious 18 August 1502 (greg.) at 12:00 midnight in Rome, Italy (Probably poisoning, age 71)

chart Placidus Equal_H.

Source Notes

Fowler's quotes Junctinus "Speculum Astrology" for "near dawn," from an unnamed biography. Mercurio-3 No.10 quotes NN No.448 for "near dawn" as 6:49 AM. LMR computes dawn as 7:19 AM LMT.

The date is given as December 31, 1430 OS; however, Britannica gives January 1, 1431, Wikipedia as well.

Categories

Family : Parenting : Kids more than 3 (Fathered many children)

Personal : Religion/Spirituality : Western (Christian, Roman Catholic)

Vocation : Religion : Ecclesiastics/ western (Roman Catholic)
